page.title: 16SHOE INDUSTRY:UNEMPLOYMENT
page.content: The shoe industry used to be the biggest employer in Irchester but now there are only two small factories where shoes are made. The last big factory which was employing 140 people a year ago is now closing down and only has 8 people working there,and all of those are in the offices.The four km sq covering the south-west of Rushden although built-up does not include any industrial estates.However we found 5 shoe factories amongst the houses, remnants of the industry on which Rushden's early prosperity was based. The most popular job in Rushden is still the shoe trade followed by jobs in engineering and plastics.People will take jobs anywhere in the surrounding area particulary on bus routes.By our calculations there is 10% unemployment in Rushden.There appears to be equal opportunities for women.
